columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to determine the effective annual interest rate.
**Effective annual interest rate** is interest rate recalculated the nominal rate and given as the comparable interest rate if compound interest was paid annually in arrears.

In this problem, effective annual interest rate is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \dfrac{\text{Interest}}{\text{Total Net Amount Available}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Let's identify the given figures in the problem.


| | | 
|--|--:| 
|Loan Amount |25,000,000 | 
|Interest Rate | 8.25%| 
| Compensating Balance Rate| 5%|

To begin, let's compute the interest paid by multiplying the loan amount by the interest rate.


$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Interest} &= \text{Loan Amount}\times{\text{Interest Rate}}\\[10pt]
&= \text{\$\hspace{5pt}25,000,000}\times{\text{8.25\%}}\\[10pt]
&=\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}2,062,500}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Next, we will compute total net amount available by subtracting the difference between loan amount and interest by compensating balance. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Total NAA} &=({\text{Loan Amount - Interest)}} - {(\text{Loan Amount}\times{{i})}}\\[10pt]
&=({\text{\$ 25,000,000 - 2,062,500)}} - {(\text{\$ 25,000,000 }\times{{5\%})}}\\[10pt]
&={\text{\$ 22,937,500}} -{\text{\$ 1,250,000}}\\[10pt]
&=\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}21,687,500}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Now that we have computed the amount of interest and total net amount available, let's now calculate the effective annual interest rate using the equation in step 3.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \dfrac{\text{Interest}}{\text{Total Net Amount Available}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{2,062,500}}{\text{21,687,500}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{9.51\%}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the effective annual interest rate on this lending arrangement is **9.51%.**
